item.title: Making Hover buttons
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:15, topic:233756”][quote author=Adds10 link=topic=308244.msg2466653#msg2466653 date=1222742285]
These guys ranting your js skills are idiots, they don’t know that javascript is being used a lot on navigators now-a-day…
[/quote]The thing is… You don’t need it. Why use something that’s not standardized at all?[/quote]
Why even use JS if you can do it with some basic CSS, like shown above?

Read full topic

item.title: Making Hover buttons
item.dc:creator: @Mupescape Mupescape
item.description:
@Mupescape wrote:

Okay, well I finally got this working…but the ‘onmouseover’ shit apparently doesn’t
here is teh long coooooode…lol

[code]

  • Forums
  • Navigation Item 2
  • Navigation Item 3
  • Navigation Item 4
  • Forums
body {margin:25px; font:12px Verdana, Arial, Helvetica} * {padding:0; margin:0} .dropdown {float:left; padding-right:5px} .dropdown dt {width:188px; border:2px solid #D3D3D3; padding:8px; font-weight:bold; cursor:pointer; background:url(http://i180.photobucket.com/albums/x303/mystickid2k6/header.gif)} .dropdown dt:hover {background:url(http://i180.photobucket.com/albums/x303/mystickid2k6/header_over.gif)} .dropdown dd {position:absolute; overflow:hidden; width:208px; display:none; background:#fff; z-index:200; opacity:0} .dropdown ul {width:204px; border:2px solid #D3D3D3; list-style:none; border-top:none} .dropdown li {display:inline} .dropdown a, .dropdown a:active, .dropdown a:visited {display:block; padding:5px; color:#333; text-decoration:none; background:url(http://i180.photobucket.com/albums/x303/mystickid2k6/Hover_out-1.png)} .dropdown a:hover {background:url(http://i180.photobucket.com/albums/x303/mystickid2k6/Hover.png)} .dropdown .underline {border-bottom:1px solid #000000} [/code]
Now what doesn’t seem to be working is the ‘Onmouseover’ part for the navigation it just always appears there…and the first three "Navigation Item’s " don’t seem to be working either…anyone got any Ideas?

Read full topic

item.title: Making Hover buttons

There’s no need to use JS.

item.title: Making Hover buttons
item.dc:creator: @belbn belbn
item.description:
@belbn wrote:

I would like to let everyone know that for hover buttons, javascript is retarded.

Using css you can do for example:

div{
background: url(regular image);}

div:hover{
background: url(hoverimage);}

if you need specific help just google css hover

Read full topic

item.title: Making Hover buttons
item.dc:creator: @Mupescape Mupescape
item.description:
@Mupescape wrote:

I’m having some trouble making some HTML hover buttons
I will appreciate as much help as possible since I’m yet trying to understand the basics of HTML, I’ve searched through the guides on Google and “Web Design Tutorial List and Source List!” okay well this is my problem:

Since I don’t have a website that lets you upload file contents (like Freewebs file manager) I’m using a Piczo host. Now since I can’t do that or maybe I’m just probably doing this wrong I tried to take the source from another piczo website and try and replace the images with mine but that jsut not quite working out right.

Here’s the code:

[code]




[/code]

so what it looks like is this:

http://cdnimg.piczo.com/static/microsites/tips/get-strt-black.gif

when hovered:

http://cdnimg.piczo.com/static/microsites/tips/get-start-green.gif

these are my images:

http://i180.photobucket.com/albums/x303/mystickid2k6/bt4r3wm_0-2.png

when hovered:

http://i180.photobucket.com/albums/x303/mystickid2k6/bt4r3wm_1-1.gif

Now I would really appreciate it if someone can help me fix this code so it is suitable for my website.
Thanks,

  • Mupescape

Read full topic
